message.content:
cs.AI, cs.DL, cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.LG. 

The paper discusses the development of a knowledge graph-based infrastructure for scholarly knowledge curation, publication, and processing. This involves the use of automated and crowdsourced techniques to acquire scholarly knowledge in machine-actionable form. The paper also mentions the use of natural language processing and machine learning techniques to process scholarly knowledge. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.AI and cs.DL, which deal with artificial intelligence and machine learning. The paper also involves information retrieval (cs.IR), computational linguistics (cs.CL), and large-scale data analysis (cs.LG), which are also relevant sub-categories.
